title: A's Kurtz becomes first rookie with 4-HR game

title: Bihar: Woman collapses during home guard recruitment drive; allegedly gang-raped inside ambulance

title: Uttarakhand: Landslide blocks Kedarnath route near Gaurikund; pilgrims halted
content: The trekking route to Kedarnath Dham, near Gaurikund, has been closed due to a landslide triggered by a hillock collapse on Friday night. The Public Works Department is working to clear the debris and restore the path. Security personnel are assisting pilgrims returning from Kedarnath, while those heading towards the shrine from Gaurikund have been stopped.

title: Shocking! Jasprit Bumrah to quit Test cricket?

title: JD Vance on Al taking jobs: If robots are coming for our jobs, you would...

Speaking at the AI Action Summit in Paris, Vance argued that AI will augment human labor, boosting productivity and creating new job opportunities.

title: Piyush Goyal lauds India-UK FTA; calls it 'stepping stone towards Viksit Bharat'

The comprehensive FTA, awaiting UK Parliamentary approval, aims to eliminate duties on 99% of Indian exports to the UK.

title: EU sanctions on Russia oil: Indian arm of UAE-based shipping company takes a hit
content: The EU has imposed sanctions on Intershipping Services Hub, an Indian subsidiary of a UAE-based firm, and Captain Abhinav Kamal for allegedly aiding Russian oil trade. These sanctions, limited to EU entities, freeze European assets and restrict business dealings.

title: Bryan Johnson is planning to shut down or sell his anti-aging startup, says: The problem is now ...
content: Bryan Johnson, the millionaire behind Project Blueprint, is considering shutting down or selling his anti-aging startup due to philosophical conflicts and difficulties in scaling his personalized protocols. He feels the business undermines his credibility in the philosophical space and distracts from his focus on 'Don't Die,' a belief system centered on radical life extension.

title: Mohit Suri‚Äôs ‚ÄòSaiyaara‚Äô becomes 2025‚Äôs second-biggest hit, beats 'Housefull 5'
content: Mohit Suri's Saiyaara is a box office hit. The film stars Ahaan Pandya and Aneet Padda. Saiyaara has earned Rs 190.25 crore in just eight days. It surpassed Housefull 5 collections. Experts predict a Rs 250 crore lifetime run. The film's success continues due to postponed releases. Saiyaara's second Friday earned Rs 17.50 crore.

title: 'Forever indebted': Tributes pour in from cricketers, IPL teams on Kargil Vijay Diwas
content: India commemorated the anniversary of Kargil Vijay Diwas, honouring the Indian armed forces' bravery and victory in the 1999 Kargil War. Former cricketers like Sachin Tendulkar and VVS Laxman, along with IPL teams such as Chennai Super Kings and Mumbai Indians, paid tribute to the soldiers' sacrifices on social media.

title: Kiss cam scandal: Astronomer teams up with Chris Martin's ex-wife Gwyneth Paltrow
content: Following a viral kiss cam incident involving its CEO and HR head at a Coldplay concert, tech company Astronomer has hired Gwyneth Paltrow as a temporary spokesperson. Paltrow's appearance in a promotional video aims to deflect attention from the scandal with humor. The company hopes to leverage the unexpected publicity, despite mixed reactions to the PR stunt.

title: Big Shots, Ullu, ALTT and 20 other OTT apps banned: Read govt's 'ban order'
content: The Indian government has banned public access to over 40 OTT platforms, including Ullu and ALTT, for violating laws related to obscene and sexually explicit content. These platforms were found in breach of the Information Technology Act, the Bharatiya Nyaya Sanhita, and the Indecent Representation of Women Act.

title: ‚ÄòOBCs will have to think ...‚Äô: Cong leader likens Rahul to Ambedkar; BJP slams comparison
content: The BJP has intensified its criticism of Congress following Udit Raj's statement suggesting Rahul Gandhi could become a "second Ambedkar" with OBC support. Amit Malviya accused Congress of plotting to diminish Ambedkar's legacy, while Rahul Gandhi acknowledged his past failure to protect the OBC community and pledged to rectify it with a caste census.

title: 'Teams win because of combinations, not ...': Sidhu slams Gambhir's tactics
content: Former cricketer Navjot Singh Sidhu has strongly criticised Gautam Gambhir's team selection strategy during the ongoing Test series against England, particularly in the fourth Test. Sidhu expressed frustration over the frequent changes in the team composition, which he believes has disrupted the team's rhythm and hindered their ability to perform collectively.

title: India-UK trade deal: States, sectors set to gain from tariff cuts- see list
content: India and the UK are signing a trade agreement. This deal will remove tariffs and make trade easier. Maharashtra will export more engineering goods and medicines. Gujarat will see growth in pharma and seafood exports. Tamil Nadu's textile and leather industries will benefit. Other states like Andhra Pradesh and Punjab will also experience export growth.

title: Cambodia calls for immediate ceasefire with Thailand; 13 killed in border clashes
content: Cambodia urged an immediate ceasefire with Thailand following two days of intense cross-border conflict. The clashes occurred near the Preah Vihear and Prasat Ta Muen Thom temples. Both nations exchanged rockets and artillery fire. The United Nations Security Council addressed the situation. Casualties included soldiers and civilians on both sides.

title: ‚ÄòWe are underpaid‚Äô: Stephen Curry sparks salary debate
content: Stephen Curry ignited a debate about NBA player compensation by suggesting that stars are underpaid relative to the league's soaring valuations. He argued that the current CBA structure prevents players from participating in equity, limiting their potential earnings. Curry believes players deserve a share in the league's financial success, advocating for changes to the CBA.

title: Democratic Leader Approval Ratings: PM Modi tops global list again; where does Trump rank?
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi continues to be the most popular global leader, securing a 75% approval rating according to Morning Consult's latest data from July 4-10, 2025. He is followed by South Korean President Lee Jae Myung and Argentina's Javier Milei.

title: Maharashtra horror: HIV+ girl raped for 2 years by care-home staffer; forced to abort
content: Latur police are investigating a harrowing case involving a 16-year-old HIV positive girl who alleges repeated rape by a staffer at her residential facility over two years. She was also forced to undergo an abortion. The facility's director, his wife, and another staffer have been arrested for allegedly suppressing the matter.

title: WATCH: Bumrah's staircase stumble triggers major injury scare for India
content: India faced injury concerns on Day 3 of the fourth Test as Jasprit Bumrah appeared to hurt his ankle, while Mohammed Siraj also struggled with discomfort. England capitalised, with Joe Root's magnificent 150 propelling them to a commanding 544/7, establishing a substantial 186-run lead. Ben Stokes remained unbeaten, steering England towards a potential series-clinching victory.

title: 'Missed important meeting': Air India flyers spend 2 hours in plane after taxiing
content: An Air India flight (AI-2982) from Delhi to Pune experienced a technical issue on Friday, causing significant delays for its 150 passengers. After taxiing, the Airbus A-320 returned to the bay, leaving passengers waiting anxiously for two hours. Passengers expressed frustration over the lack of communication and missed business meetings.

title: IND v ENG | Weather Updates: Will rain hurt India's chances on Day 4?
content: The weather forecast for Day 4 of the crucial India vs England fourth Test at Old Trafford predicts light rain in the morning, potentially impacting India's batting performance as they trail in the series.

title: ITC announces Rs 20,000cr investment push: Focus on FMCG margin boost
content: ITC Ltd. is set to invest Rs 20,000 crore across its diverse business sectors over the next five to six years, following the inauguration of eight new manufacturing facilities. The company, having already invested ‚Çπ4,500 crore in capex over the last two years, is also eyeing potential acquisitions to bolster growth.

title: 'We told sir bricks were falling': Students raised alarm before Rajasthan school collapsed; 7 dead
content: In a tragic incident in Piplodi, Jhalawar, a classroom ceiling collapse at a government school resulted in the deaths of seven children and injuries to over 20 others. Villagers reported the school building was in disrepair for decades and teachers ignored students' warnings about the dangerous conditions.

title: 'Boasted friendship...': Jairam Ramesh targets PM Modi; lists '4 facts'
content: Congress leader Jairam Ramesh has strongly criticized Prime Minister Modi's foreign policy, citing recent US actions involving Pakistan as evidence of its failure. Ramesh highlighted President Trump's claims of intervening in India-Pakistan conflict, US Central Command's praise for Pakistan's counter-terrorism efforts, and meetings between US officials and Pakistani leaders.

title: 'Beyond India now': Ex-England cricketer questions Shubman Gill's tactics
content: England dominated India in the fourth Test at Old Trafford, with Joe Root's impressive 150 putting them in a commanding lead. Jonathan Trott highlighted India's bowling struggles, particularly the lack of support for Bumrah. Shubman Gill faced a tough captaincy challenge on his first England tour. Sanjay Manjrekar urged India to fight back, despite the uneven bounce of the pitch.

title: ‚ÄòStop immigration and ‚Ä¶ wind mills‚Äô: Trump tells Europe to get its ‚Äòact together‚Äô
content: Donald Trump visited Scotland for five days. He spoke about immigration in Europe. Trump criticised wind energy and praised his administration's immigration policies. He visited his golf courses. Trump is scheduled to meet UK Prime Minister Keir Starmer. He has family ties to Scotland. A state visit is planned for September.

title: 'He'll break Tendulkar's record in 2027': Vaughan's bold prediction for Root
content: Joe Root's magnificent 150 in the fourth Test propelled him past Dravid, Kallis, and Ponting, securing the second-highest run-scorer position in Test cricket. Michael Vaughan boldly predicted Root would surpass Sachin Tendulkar's record in 2027, while Ricky Ponting also supported Root's potential to become No. 1. Root's 38th century ties him with Sangakkara, potentially shaping the series outcome.

title: Karnataka Bhavan row: Siddaramaiah, DKS aides clash in Delhi
content: A public dispute erupted in Delhi between aides of Karnataka's Chief Minister Siddaramaiah and Deputy CM DK Shivakumar at Karnataka Bhavan. The confrontation involved alleged threats and abusive language, leading to formal complaints and calls for an inquiry. The Chief Minister has directed an investigation into the matter following complaints from women staff regarding the DCM's aide's behavior.

title: ‚ÄòJoote khane bhej dia...‚Äô: When Pak DGMO came for key talks; how the meet helped end the Kargil War
content: In July 1999, as Pakistani troops retreated during the Kargil War, PM Vajpayee arranged a DGMO-level meeting at Attari. Lt Gen Bhandari recalls his surprise at seeing Pak DGMO Lt Gen Zia arrive alone, lamenting he was sent to 'take the blows' by PM Nawaz Sharif.

title: Watch | De Villiers names top batters and bowlers across formats: 'Kallis, ...'
content: AB de Villiers, the South African legend, recently shared his all-time top three batters and bowlers across all formats, sparking debate among cricket fans. His picks for batters include Jacques Kallis, Ricky Ponting, and Virat Kohli, while his bowlers list features Mohammad Asif, Dale Steyn, and Glenn McGrath.

title: Cambodia-Thailand conflict: Indian embassy issues advisory; shares helpline numbers
content: The Indian embassy in Cambodia has advised its citizens to avoid traveling to the Cambodia-Thailand border due to ongoing clashes. Similar advisory was issued by the Indian embassy in Thailand, urging travelers to stay updated on local conditions. The conflict has resulted in numerous casualties and displacement of thousands, prompting international concern and a United Nations Security Council emergency meeting.

title: Who is Aaron ‚ÄòTex‚Äô Johnson? MMA fighter removed from plane after outburst
content: MMA fighter Aaron "Tex" Johnson was removed from a Southwest Airlines flight at LaGuardia Airport following a heated dispute over baggage, captured in a viral video. Johnson's outburst included shouting at airline staff and arguing with passengers, leading to a disorderly conduct summons. In this article, we also take a look at his personal life and fighting career.

title: Kerala jailbreak: Officials clueless on how Govindachamy escaped prison; found hiding in well
content: Govindachamy, a life convict notorious for the 2011 rape and murder case, escaped from Kannur Central Prison early Friday. Authorities discovered his absence during a morning inspection, finding clothes hanging from the prison wall. A statewide manhunt was launched, leading to his apprehension within hours after a local resident's tip-off.

title: Risking lives on piggyback: Himachal kids brave perilous journeys to school
content: In Himachal Pradesh's Bharmour, students face peril daily. They must cross a raging rivulet to attend school. Villagers plead for a bridge or culvert. Their requests remain unanswered. Pilgrims visiting Banni Mata temple also suffer. The Chamba deputy commissioner promised a culvert before the next monsoon. This will channel water under the road. It will ensure safer passage for all.

title: IND vs ENG: 'A major red flag' - Ex-India cricketer slams Shubman Gill's captaincy
content: Former India cricketer Sanjay Manjrekar has criticised Shubman Gill's captaincy during the fourth Test against England, highlighting the delayed introduction of Washington Sundar as a significant concern. Despite the pitch favoring spin, Gill's reluctance to utilise Sundar until the 69th over, even after his impactful performance at Lord's, drew sharp criticism.

title: Ekta Kapoor issues clarification on BANNED OTT platforms; claims she stepped down
content: Ekta Kapoor has refuted claims that her OTT platform, ALTT, was banned for obscene content. Kapoor clarified that she and her mother, Shobha Kapoor, stepped down from ALTT in June 2021 and have no current association. This statement follows reports that the Indian government blocked 25 OTT apps, including ALTT, for allegedly streaming pornographic material violating Indian laws.

title: 75+ Kargil Vijay Diwas 2025: Wishes, messages, quotes, images
content: Kargil Vijay Diwas, observed annually on July 26th, commemorates the courage and sacrifice of Indian soldiers during the Kargil War. It serves as a potent reminder of their unwavering dedication and unity in defending the nation's integrity amidst challenging conditions.

title: 'Dust, sweat and blood': White House uses Roosevelt speech to cast Trump as fighter
content: The White House invoked Theodore Roosevelt's "Man in the Arena" speech to portray Donald Trump as a resilient leader confronting adversity. An image of Trump in a Roman-style arena accompanied the quote, emphasizing his determination amidst controversies, including recent allegations.

title: Texas Democrat dragged out of meeting for yelling, officer falls on him ‚Äì watch video
content: During a contentious redistricting hearing in Austin, Democratic congressional candidate Isaiah Martin was forcibly removed and arrested after exceeding his speaking time and refusing to stop. The incident escalated when security officers dragged him out, leading to a scuffle. Martin faced charges of criminal trespass, disrupting a meeting, and resisting arrest, but all charges were subsequently dropped.

title: Who after Kohli & Dhoni? Shastri reveals India's next pin-up boy: 'He's young, fresh ‚Ä¶‚Äô
content: Ravi Shastri has identified Shubman Gill as the next potential superstar of Indian cricket, poised to emulate the endorsement success of Sachin Tendulkar, MS Dhoni, and Virat Kohli. Shastri highlighted Gill's leadership, batting prowess, and youthful appeal as key factors, predicting he will become a prominent figure in Indian cricket.

title: Dwayne 'The Rock' Johnson pens emotional tribute to Hulk Hogan - WATCH
content: Dwayne "The Rock" Johnson paid tribute to Hulk Hogan, his childhood hero and friend, following Hogan's death from cardiac arrest at 71. Johnson shared an emotional Instagram post recalling their WrestleMania X8 match and a touching childhood memory. He remembered Hogan gifting him a headband after their initial meeting, highlighting the profound impact Hogan had on his life and career.

title: What is Tea? Women-only app hit by massive data breach; it lets women review men
content: Tea, a women-only dating advice app, experienced a data breach exposing approximately 72,000 user images. The leaked data included selfies with photo IDs used for verification and images from posts and direct messages. The company confirmed the breach affected users who signed up before February 2024 and is working with cybersecurity experts to secure its systems.

title: England's savior Agyemang embracing super-sub role, but what's next for her?
content: cristiano ronaldo scores the winning penalty in the 118th minute . the 19-year-old striker has become an "agent of chaos" who has salvaged the Lionesses campaign with late goals . she struck the equalizer in the quarterfinal against Sweden to make it 2-2 .

content: a panel of ESPN hockey commentators, analysts, reporters and editors send in a 1-32 poll based on how strong each team will be in the 2025-26 season . this edition includes the top storyline for each team during the summer break, which generates our master list .

title: Best of the rest: Who's left in NHL free agency?
content: all but seven NHL teams have at least $1 million to spend on their rosters . 11 teams have north of $10 million of cap space . the unrestricted pool is essentially a shallow creek with very few impactful free agents .

content: training camps have kicked off around the NFL . the latest intel on standouts, highlights, position battles, depth chart movement, cut decisions and, of course, the quarterback room . follow the links below to learn everything we are seeing and hearing at camp .

title: Power Rankings: A red-hot NL team surges up to debut at No. 1
content: a new team atop our power rankings after the first week of the second half . the Brewers were the biggest riser in Week 17 going from No. 9 in our final rankings before the All-Star break to No. 1 . in the American League, the Tigers have been overtaken by the Astros and Blue Jays .

title: NBA execs debate the rookie class: Flagg runaway ROY? Biggest steal?
content: the 2025 draft has wrapped up, with the rookie class debuting at summer leagues and teams looking ahead to next season . we polled 20 anonymous executives and scouts, asking for their thoughts on the draft and what teams are expecting from their new faces .

title: How Jen Welter‚Äôs hiring by the Cardinals has changed the NFL landscape for women
content: a decade ago, when she was 12, she was her first love . her father, former Div. III player Lawyer Wilson, Jr., taught her the game . she is entering her second season as an assistant coach with the Buffalo Bills .

title: MLB trade grades: How much do Friday's trades help Yankees, Mets?

title: Clash of Clans Summer Jam offers players the chance to join Travis Hunter's team
content: Supercell has announced that it has partnered with Travis Hunter for the summer jam . the event is designed to help players get their villages back into shape . Hunter is a highly respected athlete, but also an active Clash of Clans player . it is set to last until Aug. 1 .
